Empty Product
In a monoid, the empty product is defined as the unit element, i.e., $\prod_{i=1}^{0} a_{i} := e$, where $e$ is the unit element.
Order of an element
The order of an element $a$ in a group $G$ is defined as the order of the cyclic group generated by $a$ in $G$. It is the smallest positive integer $m$ such that $a^{m}=1$.
Field
A field is a commutative division ring.
Principal Ideal
For an element $a \in R$, the principal ideal generated by $a$ is $R a:=\{r a ; r \in R\}$. It is the smallest ideal in $R$ containing $a$.
Greatest common divisor

An element $d \in R$ is called a greatest common divisor of $x_{1}, \ldots, x_{n} \in R$ if: (i) $d \mid x_{i}$ for $i=1, \ldots, n$, i.e., $d$ is a common divisor of all the $x_{i}$. (ii) If $a \in R$ is a common divisor of the $x_{i}$, i.e., if $a \mid x_{i}$ for $i=1, \ldots, n$, then $a \mid d$.
Free system of generators (basis)

A family (x_i)_{i in I} of elements of an A-module M is called free or linearly independent if from an equation sum_{i in I} a_i x_i = 0 with coefficients a_i in A we can conclude that a_i = 0 for all i in I. A free system of generators will also be referred to as a basis.
Length of an A-module
The length l_A(M) of an A-module M is defined as the supremum of all numbers l such that there is a chain of submodules 0 subsetneq M_1 subsetneq M_2 subsetneq ... subsetneq M_l = M of length l.
Degree of a Field Extension

Let $K \subset L$ be a field extension. The vector space dimension $[L: K]:=\operatorname{dim}_{K} L$ is called the degree of $L$ over $K$. The field extension is called finite or infinite, depending on whether $[L: K]$ is finite or infinite.
Splitting Field of a polynomial $X^q-X$ over its prime subfield

A field $\\[\mathbb{F}\]$ is a splitting field of a polynomial $X^q-X$ over its prime subfield $\\[\mathbb{F}_p\]$ if the polynomial factorizes into linear factors in $\\[\mathbb{F}\]$. This implies that $\\[\mathbb{F}\]$ contains all zeros of $X^q-X$.
Group Action

Let $G$ be a group and $X$ a set. An action or an operation of $G$ on $X$ is a map $G \times X \longrightarrow X, \quad(g, x) \longmapsto g \cdot x$ such that: (i) $1 \cdot x=x$ for the unit element $1 \in G$ and for elements $x \in X$. (ii) $(g h) \cdot x=g \cdot(h \cdot x)$ for $g, h \in G, x \in X$.
p-group
A finite group G is called a p-group if the order of G is a power of p, where p is a prime number.
Subset
A subset is a set where all of its elements are also contained within another set.
Inheritance_Analysis

Generalization_Specialization_Relationsh.Explanation: A field is a generalization of a splitting field of a polynomial $X^q-X$ over its prime subfield, as the latter is a specific type of field designed to contain all roots of the polynomial $X^q-X$, thus inheriting all properties of a field.
